How To Train Your Dragon

    How to train your dragon is a movie franchise with three animated movies and a live-action in
    production to be released in this year (2025) still.

    "How to Train Your Dragon" began as a concept developed by Chris Sanders and Dean DeBlois, two veteran animators at DreamWorks Animation. 
    The idea was born out of a desire to create a story that would challenge traditional notions of good vs. evil and explore the complexities
    of relationships between humans and animals. Sanders and DeBlois drew inspiration from their own childhood experiences, mythology, and
    fantasy literature, as well as the world of Viking history and culture.

The franchise


    The movie's success sparked a franchise, with two sequels, "How to Train Your Dragon 2" and "How to Train Your Dragon: The Hidden World," 
    following in its footsteps. The franchise has also expanded into various other media, including video games, TV specials, and merchandise. 
    The franchise's enduring popularity can be attributed to its relatable characters, engaging storylines, and themes of acceptance, friendship,
    and self-discovery. The "How to Train Your Dragon" franchise has become a beloved and iconic brand, entertaining audiences around the world
    andinspiring new generations of fans.

    The franchise is loosely based off the book series made of twelve novels of same name released between 2003 and 2015.
    Beside the three movies, the franchise contains a couple of series that complete the story between the movies, although, the series are
    mostly unknown or disconsidered by the general public, for the exception of the most recently released which became an internet meme for
    its graphics and storytelling methods tagerted at a younger audience.
